result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M. McCann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The fine and costs are to be paid on May 24, 2022 to the Taylor County Clerk of Court's office.    Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas M. McCann

records.addlTxt: 10:40 AM Defendant Thomas M. McCann in court.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record. Court finds defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives right to an attorney.  Plea of guilty.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of misdemeanor bail jumping.  Court orders $368.00 fine and $200.00 DNA sample and surcharge. Fine and costs shall be paid in full today. Apeal rights given to defendant.   - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.   Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.

01:26 PM Defendant Thomas M. McCann in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Court advised defendant of right to attorney.   Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.  Court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00; booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm. - rt
